meanings.definition: Lack of variety or change; tedious repetition.
meanings.sent1: The monotony of the daily routine made him feel bored.
meanings.sent2: The monotony of the assembly line work was mind-numbing.
meanings.sent3: The monotony of watching paint dry was surprisingly calming.
meanings.sent4: The monotony of the dripping faucet echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent5: The monotony of the ticking clock filled the room with a sense of stillness.

meanings.sent1: The singer's voice had a soothing monotony that put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The monotony of the white walls in the room was depressing.
meanings.sent3: The monotony of the endless rain made the day feel never-ending.
meanings.sent4: The monotony of the buzzing bees in the garden created a peaceful atmosphere.
